item.title: Clinical Trials
item.description: Learning Objectives The Scientific Method The differences between evidence supporting a hypothesis and hypothesis generating information How to link a simple hypothesis in words to an objective that can be tested How to pick a good endpoint About clinical equipoise Why we blind Why we randomize The very basics of simple trial design How to ask for help to design a more complicated trial Lecture Notes Lecture I: Introduction Lecture II: Hypotheses and Objectives Lecture III: Blinding and Equipoise Lecture IV: Case Study Resources References Friedman LM, Furberg CD, and DeMets DL: Fundamentals of Clinical Trials, Springer (2015).

item.title: Predictive Modeling in Medical Research
item.description: Learning Objectives Understand how predictions differ from associations Understand the term “machine learning” and its role in medical research Describe a predictive model, comparing and contrasting single-variable and multi-variable models Name and recognize common measures of predictive accuracy Understand the difference between in-sample and out-of-sample prediction Be aware of terminology related to prediction models in medical research Identify problems related to overfitting in the development of a predictive model List statistical strategies to avoid overfitting and overoptimisim bias Lecture Notes Lecture I: Introduction Lecture II: Measures of Accuracy Lecture III: Predictive Signatures Lecture IV: Case Study Resources References Margaret Sullivan Pepe.
